title: Is "kys" part of the no tolerance rule?

replies.body:
> [{quoted}](name=Zed genius,realm=EUNE,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=eVvjYp7K,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-04-13T13:57:27.721+0000)
>
> i think yes

Why do i never see people punished for it? 

{{sticker:sg-lux-2}}

we see it all the time here in Player Behaviour. Even qouting it results in a Penality when reported. 

Never, ever do something like this: "Writing Kys is bannable you know, X ", as it will also get you banned.

Context doesn't matter for the dealing of a punishment, but it can matter for having the punishment reviewed.  If someone gets punished for saying "kys" in the same way you did here the punishment can be overwritten via support ticket.

It's still best to avoid this whole situation to begin with of course, but still.
It CAN, but thats not a gurantee. You can tell someone kys is bannable in a herassing way.

> [{quoted}](name=BIoodwing,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=eVvjYp7K,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2018-04-13T13:59:17.367+0000)
>
> Why do i never see people punished for it? 
> 
> {{sticker:sg-lux-2}}

They're not under any obligation to respond to every player, a report of those who have been punished. The feature that does notify someone is intentionally limited to the last report to cause the punishment for a reason. Even then, the player that is punished is left anonymous in the notification.

That would be because you aren't notified every single time someone you report gets punished. It's not consistent enough to actually determine if they were or weren't banned just from the popup you sometimes get in-client.

> [{quoted}](name=BIoodwing,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=eVvjYp7K,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2018-04-13T13:59:17.367+0000)
>
> Why do i never see people punished for it? 
> 
> {{sticker:sg-lux-2}}

just go type ky..s a couple games and test it out for yourself. just because you dont get the feedback message saying someone you reported was punished doesnt mean they werent
I was told kys last week by 2 people. I got in a game with one of them a few matches later. Unless someone mass report they not getting banned
Why do you need to be told that telling someone to go commit suicide is a serious offense? Should that not be self-evident?

It is definitely on the 0 tolerance policy list.

You have to report them and then the IFS has to get to the game. Just be patient, with millions upon millions of games happening all the time, the IFS is busy and people who say things on the 0 tolerance policy list will get punished once the IFS gets to reviewing the game.
I wonder if you could write "Keep Yourself Safe ;)" and get away with it. I'm actually curious as to how far the system goes to assume context for this kind of stuff

Telling anyone to Act in self-harm is bannable under any context.
(unless its with friends in voice chat)

yup.

writing it twice in a game will give you an instant 14 day ban
